translated: The Story of Elder Pūjana of the Pulina
Like a crest shining forth,🔽like a bull among the Nīsa clan,
shining forth like a medicinal herb,
illuminating the bull among men.
Raising my hands in respectful salutation,🔽I bowed to the Teacher;
I praised the Teacher,
and I satisfied him with my own work.
Taking a very pure pulina,
I scattered it on the path I had gone;
Taking it on my shoulder,
to the great sage Vipassī.
Then with half a pulina,
with a clear mind,
I sprinkled it on the dwelling place,
of the Tamed One, the Lord of bipeds.
For ninety-one eons,
I sprinkled the pulina;
I do not know of a bad destination,
this is the fruit of the pulina.
The four analytical insights,
… and so on …
